config.question: Why was Taft’s proposal for a special Commerce Court opposed by progressives?

choices.content: Most of the members of the Commerce Court were railroad owners.
The arrangement would render the ICC a toothless regulatory body.
The Commerce Court was packed with novices with no railroad knowledge.
Most of the judges would be conservatives who rejected railroad regulation.

answer_3.response: Consider This: The Commerce Court was created to hear appeals from ICC decisions. This pleased the conservatives. See L.O. 23.5 The Ordeal of William Howard Taft.
